entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 1:06PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG STORM EXPECTED SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... A storm force front is expected to move into the area from the SW on Saturday spreading gusty winds and heavy precipitation across the region. Most of the precipitation is expected to fall as rain with the highest rain rates expected Saturday afternoon into Saturday night. Total rainfall of around 1 to 3 inches is expected

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 12:52PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds And Blowing Snow Through Brooks Range Passes This Weekend... Winds will increase Friday night and persist into the weekend through Brooks Range Passes. Wind gusts up to 35 mph or higher combined with loose snow on the ground will result in areas of blowing and drifting snow. Visibility will likely be reduced and

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 12:41PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow, Blowing Snow, and Cold Wind Chills This Weekend... Cold arctic air will move south from the NW Arctic over the West Coast this weekend. Strong north winds gusting as high as 40 mph will accompany the cold air Saturday night and Sunday, which will bring areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility along with wind chills as cold as -40 F. Accumulating snowfall is also
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Interior Seward Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Yukon River; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 12:40PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds And Blowing Snow Over Highway Summits This Weekend... Northeast winds will increase Friday night and persist into the weekend over higher elevations of the Steese, Elliott, and Dalton Highways. Wind gusts up to 40 mph combined with loose snow on the ground will result in areas of blowing and drifting snow.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dalton Highway Summits; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 21 at 8:54AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The risk for flooding and scattered landslides increases for the first half of Christmas week... Weak low pressure systems embedded within the South Pacific Convergence Zone is anticipated to pass through the territory Sunday through Tuesday. Although these systems aren`t expected to develop into a Tropical Cyclone, excessive rainfall is possible

entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING...
